0.Description: Elements that have not been categorized are considered Unlabeled. This category is meant to be empty or at least contain elements with no collisions.

1.Description: Part of ground on which cars usually drive. E.g. lanes in any directions, and streets.

2.Description: Part of ground designated for pedestrians or cyclists. Delimited from the road by some obstacle (such as curbs or poles), not only by markings. This label includes a possibly delimiting curb, traffic islands (the walkable part), and pedestrian zones.

3.Description: Buildings like houses, skyscrapers,... and the elements attached to them. E.g. air conditioners, scaffolding, awning or ladders and much more.

4.Description: Individual standing walls. Not part of a building.

5.Description: Barriers, railing, or other upright structures. Basically wood or wire assemblies that enclose an area of ground.

6.Description: Small mainly vertically oriented pole. If the pole has a horizontal part (often for traffic light poles) this is also considered pole. E.g. sign pole, traffic light poles.

7.Description: Traffic light boxes without their poles.

8.Description: Signs installed by the state/city authority, usually for traffic regulation. This category does not include the poles where signs are attached to. E.g. traffic-signs, parking signs, direction signs...

9.Description: Trees, hedges, all kinds of vertical vegetation. Ground-level vegetation is considered Terrain.

10.Description: Grass, ground-level vegetation, soil or sand. These areas are not meant to be driven on. This label includes a possibly delimiting curb.

11.Description: Open sky. Includes clouds and the sun.

13.Description: Humans that ride/drive any kind of vehicle or mobility system. E.g. bicycles or scooters, skateboards, horses, roller-blades, wheel-chairs, etc.

20.Description: Elements in the scene and props that are immovable. E.g. fire hydrants, fixed benches, fountains, bus stops, etc.

21.Description: Elements whose position is susceptible to change over time. E.g. Movable trash bins, buggies, bags, wheelchairs, animals, etc.

22.Description: Everything that does not belong to any other category.

23.Description: Horizontal water surfaces. E.g. Lakes, sea, rivers.

25.Description: Any horizontal ground-level structures that does not match any other category. For example, areas shared by vehicles and pedestrians, or flat roundabouts delimited from the road by a curb.

26.Description: Only the structure of the bridge. Fences, people, vehicles, and other elements on top of it are labeled separately.

27.Description: All kinds of rail tracks that are non-drivable by cars. E.g. subway and train rail tracks.

28.Description: All types of guard rails/crash barriers.
